properties.areaDesc: Upper Green River Basin Foothills; South Lincoln County; Yellowstone National Park; Star Valley; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains; Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Jackson Hole; Absaroka Mountains
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 14 at 3:40AM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
This is a special weather statement from the National Weather
Service Office in Riverton.

* WHAT...Significant snow possible. Significant blowing snow is
also expected in the mountains.

* WHERE...Far western Wyoming.

* SNOW AMOUNTS...Preliminary snowfall totals of 5 to 8 inches in
the far west valleys. For the mountains, 10 to 20 inches is
possible.

* WHEN...Saturday night through Sunday night. The heaviest snow
looks to occur during the predawn hours Sunday through the
afternoon Sunday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Please stay tuned for updates on this
developing winter storm this weekend.

NWSheadline: Significant Snow Saturday Night thru Sunday Night over Far Western Wyoming
